content: Supreme Court Justice Souter To Retire Centrist Justice Will Remain In Place Until A Successor Is Appointed (CBS) Supreme Court Justice David Souter is planning retire at the end of the current court term. Souter, 69, has informed the White House of his decision and plans to return to his native New Hampshire according to NPR. Full report at >>>http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2009/04/30/national/main4981868.shtml?tag=topStories;secondStory

content: Conservatives are already gearing up for a fight on this one - let's see if their famous "up or down vote" mantra holds true or if they try to delay and obsfucate now that Obama is nominating the justices instead of Bush.

content: quote: Originally posted by PhoenixDark: Conservatives are already gearing up for a fight on this one - let's see if their famous "up or down vote" mantra holds true or if they try to delay and obsfucate now that Obama is nominating the justices instead of Bush. Specter kind of screwed the Dems there. He was the common yes vote by the republican party needed to confirm someone, now that he is a Dem, they may not have it quite as easy putting a left wing Judge in. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin

content: quote: Originally posted by L0A1: quote: Originally posted by PhoenixDark: Conservatives are already gearing up for a fight on this one - let's see if their famous "up or down vote" mantra holds true or if they try to delay and obsfucate now that Obama is nominating the justices instead of Bush. Specter kind of screwed the Dems there. Very funny considering that the Dems control 59 of the 99 seats currently occupied in the Senate.
